Crete is the largest island in Greece and the fifth-largest island in the Mediterranean Sea. It is located in the southern part of Greece and is known for its stunning natural beauty, rich history, and unique culture. With its beautiful beaches, breathtaking landscapes, and fascinating history, Crete is a popular tourist destination that attracts millions of visitors every year. In this article, we will explore the top 10 must-visit attractions in Crete Island.

1. The Palace of Knossos

The Palace of Knossos is one of the most important archaeological sites in Crete and is considered the largest Bronze Age archaeological site on the island. The palace was built around 2000 BC and was the center of the Minoan civilization. The palace was destroyed in 1450 BC, but it has been restored and is now open to the public.

2. Samaria Gorge

The Samaria Gorge is a beautiful natural wonder that is located in the western part of Crete. The gorge is 16 km long and is considered one of the longest gorges in Europe. It is a popular hiking destination and attracts thousands of hikers every year.

3. Balos Lagoon

Balos Lagoon is a stunning natural wonder that is located on the western side of Crete. It is known for its crystal clear waters and white sand beaches. The lagoon is surrounded by beautiful cliffs and is a popular spot for swimming, snorkeling, and sunbathing.

4. Elafonisi Beach

Elafonisi Beach is one of the most beautiful beaches in Crete and is located in the southwestern part of the island. It is known for its pink sand and crystal clear waters. The beach is surrounded by beautiful cliffs and is a popular spot for swimming, snorkeling, and sunbathing.

5. Spinalonga Island

Spinalonga Island is a small island located in the northeastern part of Crete. The island is known for its rich history and is home to a 16th-century Venetian fortress. The island was also used as a leper colony from 1903 to 1957.

6. Agios Nikolaos

Agios Nikolaos is a picturesque town located on the eastern side of Crete. It is known for its beautiful beaches and stunning architecture. The town is home to a beautiful lake that is surrounded by cafes and restaurants.

7. Heraklion Archaeological Museum

The Heraklion Archaeological Museum is one of the most important museums in Greece and is located in the city of Heraklion. The museum is home to a large collection of Minoan artifacts, including pottery, jewelry, and sculptures.

Chania Old Town is a charming old town located on the western side of Crete. It is known for its beautiful architecture and narrow streets that are lined with cafes, restaurants, and shops. The town is home to a beautiful harbor that is surrounded by restaurants and cafes.

9. Rethymno Old Town

Rethymno Old Town is a charming old town located on the northern side of Crete. It is known for its beautiful architecture and narrow streets that are lined with cafes, restaurants, and shops. The town is home to a beautiful harbor that is surrounded by restaurants and cafes.

The Lassithi Plateau is a beautiful plateau located in the eastern part of Crete. It is known for its stunning natural beauty and is a popular spot for hiking and mountain biking. The plateau is also home to several traditional villages and is a great place to experience the local culture.

item.content:encoded:
Kriti Island, also known as Crete, is the largest island in Greece and a popular destination for travelers from all over the world. The island has a rich history, beautiful beaches, stunning landscapes, and delicious cuisine, making it a perfect destination for all types of travelers. In this article, we will provide a complete travel guide to discovering Kriti Island.

Getting to Kriti Island

The easiest way to get to Kriti Island is by flying into one of the island’s two international airports: Heraklion or Chania. Both airports have direct flights from major European cities, and there are also domestic flights from Athens. Alternatively, you can take a ferry from Athens or one of the other nearby islands.

Exploring Kriti Island

There is no shortage of things to do and see on Kriti Island. Here are some of the top attractions and activities:

1. Visit the Palace of Knossos: This ancient Minoan palace is one of the island’s most popular attractions. It dates back to the Bronze Age and is believed to have been the center of Minoan civilization.

2. Explore the Samaria Gorge: This 16-kilometer-long gorge is the longest in Europe and offers stunning views of the island’s natural beauty. It is a popular spot for hiking and nature walks.

3. Relax on the beaches: Kriti Island is known for its beautiful beaches, ranging from long stretches of sandy coastline to secluded coves. Some of the top beaches include Elafonisi, Balos, and Vai.

4. Taste the local cuisine: Kriti Island has a unique culinary scene, influenced by its history and geography. Some of the must-try dishes include dakos, a traditional Cretan salad, and boureki, a type of savory pie made with zucchini and potatoes.

5. Visit the Venetian Harbor of Chania: This picturesque harbor is lined with restaurants, cafes, and shops. It is a great spot for a leisurely stroll and to take in the beautiful scenery.

Where to Stay on Kriti Island

Kriti Island has a wide range of accommodation options to suit all budgets and preferences. Here are some of the top areas to consider staying in:

1. Heraklion: This is the island’s capital and a great base for exploring the nearby attractions. There are plenty of hotels, restaurants, and cafes in the area.

2. Chania: This charming town is known for its Venetian architecture and stunning harbor. It is a popular spot for tourists and has a range of accommodation options.

3. Rethymno: This town is located in the middle of the island and is known for its beautiful beaches and historic old town.

4. Agios Nikolaos: This picturesque town is located on the eastern side of the island and is known for its beautiful beaches and clear waters.

When to Visit Kriti Island

The best time to visit Kriti Island depends on your preferences and interests. The island has a Mediterranean climate, with hot summers and mild winters. The peak tourist season is from June to August when the weather is at its warmest and the beaches are at their busiest. If you prefer to avoid the crowds, consider visiting in the shoulder seasons of May or September when the weather is still warm, but the crowds are smaller.

In conclusion, Kriti Island is a beautiful destination that has something to offer for every type of traveler. Whether you are interested in history, nature, or simply relaxing on the beach, this island has it all. With its unique culture, delicious cuisine, and stunning landscapes, Kriti Island is a must-visit destination for anyone traveling to Greece.

The Sporades, a group of Greek islands located in the Aegean Sea, are the perfect summer destination for travelers seeking sun, sea, and adventure. Comprised of 24 islands, only four of which are inhabited, the Sporades offer a unique blend of relaxation and exploration.

Skiathos, the largest of the Sporades, is a popular tourist destination known for its sandy beaches, crystal-clear waters, and vibrant nightlife. Visitors can spend their days lounging on the beach, exploring the island’s charming villages, or taking part in water sports such as windsurfing and jet skiing.


Sailing enthusiasts will find the Sporades to be a paradise, as the islands offer some of the best sailing conditions in Greece. With its sheltered bays and calm waters, the Sporades are ideal for both novice and experienced sailors. Charter a yacht and set sail for the uninhabited islands of Skopelos, Alonnisos, and Skyros, where you can anchor in secluded coves and enjoy the pristine beaches and stunning scenery.


For those seeking a more active holiday, the Sporades offer a wealth of hiking and mountain biking opportunities. Alonnisos, the most remote of the inhabited islands, boasts a national marine park where visitors can hike along the rugged coastline and spot rare species of birds and marine life.


No trip to the Sporades would be complete without sampling the local cuisine. Fresh seafood, locally grown fruits and vegetables, and delicious olive oil are staples of the island’s cuisine. Be sure to try traditional dishes such as octopus stew, spinach pie, and fava beans with lemon and olive oil.


Whether you’re looking for a relaxing beach holiday or an adventure-packed trip, the Sporades offer something for everyone. With their stunning scenery, warm hospitality, and endless activities, the Sporades are the perfect summer destination.

Tucked away in the Aegean Sea, the island of Skopelos is a hidden gem that offers visitors a unique blend of natural beauty, history, and culture. Known for its lush greenery, crystal-clear waters, and charming villages, Skopelos is the perfect summer destination for travelers seeking a peaceful and authentic Greek experience.

The island’s main town, Skopelos Town, is a maze of winding alleys and white-washed houses that date back to the Byzantine era. Visitors can wander the town’s narrow streets, stopping to admire the picturesque churches and traditional architecture, or sample the island’s delicious cuisine at one of the many local tavernas.

Skopelos is also home to some of the most beautiful beaches in Greece. With their crystal-clear waters and fine golden sand, beaches such as Stafylos, Velanio, and Panormos are perfect for swimming, sunbathing, and water sports.

For those interested in history, Skopelos offers a wealth of archaeological sites and museums. The island’s ancient capital, Peparithos, is a fascinating site where visitors can explore the remains of ancient fortifications and temples, while the Folklore Museum in Skopelos Town offers a glimpse into the island’s rich cultural heritage.

Nature lovers will find plenty to explore on Skopelos, with its lush forests, olive groves, and vineyards. The island is also home to a variety of rare plant and animal species, making it an ideal destination for hiking and bird watching.

One of the highlights of Skopelos is the stunning coastline, dotted with hidden coves and secluded beaches accessible only by boat. Visitors can rent a boat and explore the coastline at their own pace, stopping to swim, snorkel, or simply bask in the sun.

With its stunning scenery, warm hospitality, and authentic culture, Skopelos is the perfect destination for travelers looking for an off-the-beaten-path summer holiday. Come and discover the hidden gem of the Sporades.

item.content:encoded:
Greece is a popular destination for couples looking to get married in a beautiful, idyllic setting. With its stunning beaches, crystal-clear waters, and warm weather, Greece offers the perfect backdrop for a summer wedding. Here are some of the most idyllic places in Greece to get married in the summer.

Santorini

Santorini is one of the most popular wedding destinations in Greece. This stunning island, known for its white-washed buildings and picturesque views of the Aegean Sea, offers a romantic setting for a wedding. The island is particularly popular for its sunsets, which are considered some of the most beautiful in the world. Couples can exchange vows in a traditional Greek church or on one of the island’s many stunning beaches.

Mykonos

Mykonos is another popular wedding destination in Greece. This vibrant island, known for its nightlife and cosmopolitan atmosphere, offers a unique setting for a summer wedding. Couples can exchange vows on one of the island’s beautiful beaches or in one of its many luxurious hotels or villas. Mykonos is also home to a number of world-class restaurants, making it the perfect destination for a destination wedding.

Crete

Crete is the largest island in Greece and offers a variety of stunning wedding venues. From beachfront hotels to historic chapels and monasteries, Crete has something for every couple. The island is known for its rugged mountains, stunning beaches, and crystal-clear waters, making it a popular destination for couples who love the great outdoors. Crete is also home to a number of traditional villages and towns, offering a glimpse into the island’s rich culture and history.

Rhodes

Rhodes is one of the most beautiful and historic islands in Greece. The island is known for its stunning medieval architecture, beautiful beaches, and crystal-clear waters. Couples can exchange vows in one of the island’s historic churches or in a beautiful garden setting. Rhodes is also home to a number of luxury hotels and resorts, offering the perfect backdrop for a destination wedding.

Corfu

Corfu is a stunning island located in the Ionian Sea. The island is known for its lush vegetation, beautiful beaches, and crystal-clear waters. Couples can exchange vows in one of the island’s many beautiful churches or in a stunning beachfront setting. Corfu is also home to a number of luxury hotels and resorts, offering the perfect backdrop for a romantic and idyllic wedding.

In conclusion, Greece offers a variety of idyllic places for a summer wedding. From the stunning island of Santorini to the vibrant and cosmopolitan Mykonos, Greece has something for every couple.

Whether you’re looking for a beachfront wedding, a historic church ceremony, or a luxurious hotel setting, Greece is the perfect destination for a romantic and unforgettable wedding.
